title: 'Hannibal The Cannibal' Locked In Fortress Cell Behind 17 Doors: Report
content: Robert Maudsley, dubbed "Hannibal the Cannibal," has been held in solitary confinement at Wakefield Prison for 45 years due to his extreme danger, locked behind 17 steel doors resembling conditions akin to Hannibal Lecter.
summary: Robert Maudsley, dubbed "Hannibal the Cannibal," has been held in solitary confinement at Wakefield Prison for 45 years due to his extreme danger, locked behind 17 steel doors resembling conditions akin to Hannibal Lecter.

title: Stop Interference In Judiciary By Agencies Like ISI: Pak Court To PM Office
content: A top Pakistani court on Saturday directed the Prime Minister's Office to issue directives to the country's powerful intelligence agencies, including ISI, and ask them not to approach any judge or member of their staff to obtain favourable verdicts.
summary: A top Pakistani court on Saturday directed the Prime Minister's Office to issue directives to the country's powerful intelligence agencies, including ISI, and ask them not to approach any judge or member of their staff to obtain favourable verdicts.

title: Instagram Suffer Major Outage Globally, Including In India
content: Meta-owned Instagram on Saturday suffered a major outage globally, including in India, as thousands of users were unable to load Reels and access other options.
summary: Meta-owned Instagram on Saturday suffered a major outage globally, including in India, as thousands of users were unable to load Reels and access other options.

title: Turbulence At Washington Post With Pressure For Profit From Jeff Bezos
content: The prestigious Washington Post is in crisis, with pressure on from owner Jeff Bezos to change its money-losing ways.
summary: The prestigious Washington Post is in crisis, with pressure on from owner Jeff Bezos to change its money-losing ways.

title: Joe Biden Shares Stage With Elton John To Celebrate LGBTQ Milestone
content: US President Joe Biden paid tribute to LGBTQ pioneers and British music legend Elton John performed his hits as the pair inaugurated on Friday a historical site in New York City celebrating the 1969 "Stonewall riots".
summary: US President Joe Biden paid tribute to LGBTQ pioneers and British music legend Elton John performed his hits as the pair inaugurated on Friday a historical site in New York City celebrating the 1969 "Stonewall riots".

title: Can Biden Be Replaced As Democratic Presidential Nominee? Best Way Is...
content: Within minutes of the conclusion of this weeks presidential debate between Joe Biden and Donald Trump, it became clear to many that the 81-year-old Biden may not be capable of winning the general election in November.
summary: Within minutes of the conclusion of this weeks presidential debate between Joe Biden and Donald Trump, it became clear to many that the 81-year-old Biden may not be capable of winning the general election in November.

title: Michelle Obama To Replace Joe Biden? US Senator's Bold Prediction
content: Former First Lady Michelle Obama will replace President Joe Biden as the Democratic nominee, US Senator Ted Cruz (R-Texas) has predicted.
summary: Former First Lady Michelle Obama will replace President Joe Biden as the Democratic nominee, US Senator Ted Cruz (R-Texas) has predicted.

title: Khamenei Protege, Sole Moderate Neck And Neck In Iran Presidential Race
content: A low-key moderate and a protege of Iran's supreme leader are neck-and-neck in the vote count in snap presidential elections marked by voter apathy over economic hardships and social restrictions.
summary: A low-key moderate and a protege of Iran's supreme leader are neck-and-neck in the vote count in snap presidential elections marked by voter apathy over economic hardships and social restrictions.

title: Sunita Williams May Have To Wait Months In Space. What NASA Is Planning Now
content: Projected to last only days, the first crewed test flight of Boeing's Starliner spacecraft with two astronauts onboard faces uncertainty with no exact return to Earth announced.
summary: Projected to last only days, the first crewed test flight of Boeing's Starliner spacecraft with two astronauts onboard faces uncertainty with no exact return to Earth announced.

title: Morgan Stanley Says PM Gati Shakti Scheme Gives India An Edge Over China
content: Morgan Stanley has stated that the PM Gati Shakti scheme has succeeded in giving a new fillip to India's infrastructure development and multi-modal connectivity across highways, railways and ports that has spurred economic growth.
summary: Morgan Stanley has stated that the PM Gati Shakti scheme has succeeded in giving a new fillip to India's infrastructure development and multi-modal connectivity across highways, railways and ports that has spurred economic growth.

title: Xi Jinping Lauds India's 'Panchsheel' Pact, Nehru's Non-Alligned Movement
content: Xi Jinping highlighted the relevance of the 5 Principles of Peaceful Coexistence, which gained traction with the Non-Aligned Movement, to end the present-day conflicts and sought to expand influence in the Global South amid its tussle with the West.
summary: Xi Jinping highlighted the relevance of the 5 Principles of Peaceful Coexistence, which gained traction with the Non-Aligned Movement, to end the present-day conflicts and sought to expand influence in the Global South amid its tussle with the West.

title: Insufficient Evidence: 28 Defendants Acquitted In Panama Papers Trial
content: A Panamanian court on Friday acquitted 28 people charged with money laundering at the center of the "Panama Papers" scandal, the court said.
summary: A Panamanian court on Friday acquitted 28 people charged with money laundering at the center of the "Panama Papers" scandal, the court said.

title: 5 Billion People Suffered Extreme Heat In June, 619 Million In India Alone
content: Nearly five billion people globally, including 619 million from India, experienced climate-change-driven extreme heat over nine days in June, according to a new analysis by an independent group of scientists based in the US.
summary: Nearly five billion people globally, including 619 million from India, experienced climate-change-driven extreme heat over nine days in June, according to a new analysis by an independent group of scientists based in the US.

title: "I Know I'm Not Young Man, But...": Joe Biden After Poor Debate Showing
content: Biden said on Friday he intended to defeat Republican rival Donald Trump in the November presidential election, giving no sign he would consider dropping out of the race after a feeble debate performance that dismayed his fellow Democrats.
summary: Biden said on Friday he intended to defeat Republican rival Donald Trump in the November presidential election, giving no sign he would consider dropping out of the race after a feeble debate performance that dismayed his fellow Democrats.

title: Australian PM Says He, His Family Threatened By Teen Terrorist: Report
content: Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has revealed he and his family were threatened by an accused teenage terrorist.
summary: Australia's Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has revealed he and his family were threatened by an accused teenage terrorist.

title: "Bad Debate Nights Happen": Obama's Feeble Support For Ex-Veep Biden
content: A fired-up Joe Biden came out swinging Friday as he tried to make up for a disastrous debate performance against Donald Trump, insisting he was the right man to win November's US presidential election.
summary: A fired-up Joe Biden came out swinging Friday as he tried to make up for a disastrous debate performance against Donald Trump, insisting he was the right man to win November's US presidential election.

title: UK PM "Hurt" After Far-Right Party Campaigner's Racist Slurs For Him
content: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Friday reacted to a racist slur targeted at him, saying it made him "hurt and angry".
summary: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Friday reacted to a racist slur targeted at him, saying it made him "hurt and angry".

title: US Supreme Court Rules In Favor Of January 6 Rioters
content: Prosecutors overstepped in charging January 6 rioters with obstruction for trying to prevent certification of the 2020 presidential election, the US Supreme Court said Friday, throwing hundreds of cases into doubt.
summary: Prosecutors overstepped in charging January 6 rioters with obstruction for trying to prevent certification of the 2020 presidential election, the US Supreme Court said Friday, throwing hundreds of cases into doubt.

title: 11 Palestinians Killed In Israeli Bombing In Rafah
content: At least 11 Palestinians were killed by an Israeli attack on tents housing displaced individuals in western Rafah, Gaza's southernmost city, Palestinian security and medical sources said.
summary: At least 11 Palestinians were killed by an Israeli attack on tents housing displaced individuals in western Rafah, Gaza's southernmost city, Palestinian security and medical sources said.

title: New York Times Editorial Board Calls On Biden To Leave Presidential Race
content: America's most influential newspaper, The New York Times, called in an editorial Friday for President Joe Biden to step aside and allow another Democrat to challenge Donald Trump for the White House in November.
summary: America's most influential newspaper, The New York Times, called in an editorial Friday for President Joe Biden to step aside and allow another Democrat to challenge Donald Trump for the White House in November.
